DataElement.preferredName: Family Demographics Eight Digit Missing Value Reason Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Eight-digit coded value representing why an answer was not given for survey questions about family demographics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Family Demographics Eight Digit Missing Value Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income)._A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.:A single character in a numbering system.:A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available.  A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept.  In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).

Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.:A single character in a numbering system.:A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available.  A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept.  In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.
A single character in a numbering system.

A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available. A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept. In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released as part of HINTS model clean up. mc 10/27/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents why no answer was given

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

Concepts.definition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Modified to meet best practice criteria. Released as part of UML model cleanup. mc 10/27/11
